page.title: 13CHURCHES NON CONFORMIST
page.content: The first Sawbridgeworth Congregational church was built in 1814,but in 1862 it was demolished as it was irrepairable.On March 3rd 1862 the church committee decided to build another church.In 1863 the church was ready,the foundation stone was laid by Mr. T. Thompson of Bath.The first minister was Rev.James Wood and the second was Rev.Willie Dyke who in 1904 built the Sunday school classrooms as a memorial for Mr.Wood, the foundation stone was laid by Samuel Ryder.For children and adults today, the church is very popular.The morning and evening services go from 11.00am-12.00 noon,6.30pm-7.30pm.The present minister is Mr. Moore.There is a graveyard behind the toilets and the kitchen.The church does not have a collection but you put your money into a box at the back.
